data.title: Keyboard arrows keys don't scroll in the Extensions window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home Insider Preview

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Extensions window
2. Select "Show Popular Extensions" (I think this issue will happen in any case of scrollbar appearing - showing popular extensions is enough to do the trick)
3. Select any extension that appears
4. Press continually keyboard arrow down key

It will swap the selected extensions but it is not going to scroll, what is weird.

data.title: Intellisense unusably slow for large (node.js) project on linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Linux 3.13.0-65-generic (Ubuntu 14.04)

Hey, guys. First off, kudos! Just switched from sublime text 3 a week ago and I'm liking what I see. One big issue I've faced: Intellisense stops working if my project gets too large. I've done the following to narrow the issue down:
1. Disabled all plugins. _INTELLISENSE DOESN'T WORK_
2. Duplicated the project without .git folder and opened in VSCode. _INTELLISENSE DOESN'T WORK_
3. Opened a single file/small project. _WORKS_ 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a large project (10,000+ LoC, node_modules ignored). 
2. Setup a git repo
3. Work for a couple of days (I've made 100+ commits in the past 5 days. It stopped working 3 days in)

P.S: It's a sails.js project

Thnx

data.title: [scss] Auto complete bug when editing a SASS file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version:

After the latest update, after writing a semicolon, an auto complete window pops up for no reason, and because I hit enter as usual after typing a semicolon, that window's first option is selected, which in my case is this hex color code: #16baba, which I am foreced to manually delete every time.

This happens usually after writing a value with only zero in it, such as "left: 0;".

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19216444/16792457/5a14c38a-48d1-11e6-93ad-fc3cf21d211a.jpg)

data.title: Realtime preview (with Split Editor) by one-click
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1
#### Steps to Reproduce:
- Open file.md file
- [Split Editor]
- Right-clicking the tab "file.md" in the right pane
- [Open Preview]
- Close the tab "README.md" in the right pane
#### Expected
- Open file.md file
- Right-clicking the tab "file.md" in the right pane
- [Preview in Split Editor] ?
  - Left-split tab: file.md (source)
  - Right-split tab: Preview 'file.md' (preview)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3655468/16789668/83b3df64-48ea-11e6-97c7-f0f47134c641.jpg)

data.title: Auto update always installs in 'C:\Program Files (x86)' even though VS Code was installed in different drive.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit

Due to limited space in my SSD 256GB C: drive I installed VS Code on D: drive instead. But today VS Code informed me there is a new 1.3 version and asked whether I would like to update.... I clicked Yes.

To my surprise, the installer installs the latest version into 'C:\Program Files (x86)' instead of overwriting my current installation folder.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode 1.0 into D: or E: drive... as long as it is not C: drive.
2. Run VSCode, and wait for it to offer to update itself to latest version. Click Yes.
3. The latest version (1.3 as of this writing) will be installed in 'C:\Program Files (x86)' and the old 1.0 version will be left orphaned in D: or E:

data.title: React Stateless function don't get syntax coloring
data.body:
Hi,
Using latest version of VSCode with [React Native extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vsmobile.vscode-react-native).

data.title: UX meeting agenda July 13, 2016
data.body:
**Agenda:**

TABS
- Showing local commands #8779 #7666 @alexandrudima 
- Quick Open no longer mouse accessible #8913

Should we move things to August milestone?  Perhaps #7987 tab overflow cut

OTHER
- Focusing panels like viewlets #7540 - @sandy081 @isidorn 
- REVIEW FEEDBACK: CJK strings difficult to read on standard definition monitors due to font weight and size #8653 - @Tyriar 
- Quick Open launched editors should stay open #8939
- Discuss switching to auto save enabled by default with guidance to opt out. Opt out requires support to programmatically change settings which will not be available for July. @bpasero

data.title: Add support for symlinks in remoteRoot of launch configuration for remote debugging

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OS X

Currently, breakpoints are not triggered when using a file path containing symlinks as the remoteRoot of an `attach` launch configuration.

For instance, if `current` in `/opt/myproject/current/app` is a symlink pointing to the directory of the last deployed build, the debugger will successfully attach to the process, but breakpoints will not trigger:

``` json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Attach to remote process",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "address": "my-remote-host.com",
      "port": 5858,
      "remoteRoot": "/opt/myproject/current/app",
      "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
    }
  ]
}
```
#8955

data.title: Cant install extension - Regresion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04 LTS 
- Node.js Version: 6.2.2

Hi there, I can't install extension in VSCode 1.3 I just updated my editor to 1.3 and want to install a theme 

`ext install theme-dracula`

I click the little green buttons to install the theme but nothing happens. I opened the Dev Tool and the following error appears.

```
shell.ts:416 Cannot read property 'call' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined,    at e.onCommonRequest (/opt/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/code/node/sharedProcessMain.js:6:20045),    at e.onMessage (/opt/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/code/node/sharedProcessMain.js:6:19889),    at /opt/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/code/node/sharedProcessMain.js:6:19697,    at Socket.<anonymous> (/opt/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/code/node/sharedProcessMain.js:6:23456),    at emitOne (events.js:90:13),    at Socket.emit (events.js:182:7),    at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:153:18),    at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:111:10),    at Pipe.onread (net.js:531:20)
```

Hope this can help!

data.title: Add mouse-keyboard event crossover to prevent menu bar from showing up after multi-selecting.
data.body: This PR adds a crossover between keyboard events and mouse events, and can successfully prevent the menu bar from showing up when multi-selecting, while not affecting existing “single-alt-press” or keyboard shortcut combinations.

data.title: Support group ordering
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add menus to the explorer context menu
2. Run extension
3. Note the sorting order where your contributions are at the top

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/16778866/c96040fa-4824-11e6-9087-fc557429de88.png)

Related to #8756?

The source for the extension is here: https://github.com/chrisdias/vscode-opennewinstance

data.title: Typography tune-up needed
data.body:
On VS Code for Mac, Windows and Linux we're using system fonts to fit in with the OS.

TODOS:

**Apply OS-specific guidelines on typography for optimal legibility and visual consistency**
https://developer.apple.com/ios/human-interface-guidelines/visual-design/typography/
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/style/typography

**Ensure a consistent visual hierarchy, and check consistency in**
Font-weight
Font-size
Line-height
Using the font features as typeface intends (tracking, kerning, anti-aliasing).
### Mac feedback

**Some feedback from our users**
- Seems [overweighted](https://twitter.com/brunnopleffken/status/752902520683593728)

**Some feedback from users of other products who use San Fransisco in Chrome**
- Chrome appears to have [less characters per line](https://twitter.com/dbox/status/752823539162546177) (tracks differently) than Safari.
- [Characters stand out more than words](https://twitter.com/joshuajabbour/status/752625331186462722) (tracking issue in Chrome)
- Abrupt change, [takes some getting used to](https://twitter.com/nickfogle/status/752557899914702848).

data.title: auto-update not working on mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1 tried to update to 1.3.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm not working as a root user. Each time the app asks me to download/install the update, it seems to work, but when the app is restarted, I get the old version. After a while the app asks again to update.
I always need to download the new version manually from the site and install it.

data.title: Must use 8.3 format with cmd /c when concatenating args
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Win 10, 14367

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup a tasks.json with "cmd" and tasks that it calls to invoke an exe that requires additional params passed in args. Examples of one that works using 8.3 naming and one that doesn't using long paths below. 

``` json
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd",
    "args": ["/C"],
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "isBuildCommand": false,
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
        {
         "taskName": "Task (one lame)",
         "args":[
             "C:\\PROGRA~2\\MICROS~1.0\\Common7\\IDE\\devenv.exe",
             "/?"
         ],
         "taskName": "Task (two better but broken)",
         "args":[
             "C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0/Common7/IDE/devenv.exe",
             "/?"   
         ]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Debug adapter 'continued' event not working
data.body:
vscode-chrome-debug is firing the private 'continued' event to support the continued button that shows up on the Chrome window, but it seems like that's not working anymore. Is there still some way to implement this?

Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug#201

data.title: Feature: Focus Tab by Number
data.body: It's very handy to be able to move to a tab by selecting tab number, e.g. Cmd+3 focuses the third tab, Cmd+1 focuses the first one.  I'd like to be able to set these keyboard shortcuts!  Pretty much all of the popular editors allow this.

data.title: Submodule Gutter Indicators
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite

Feature Request:

Right now, it appears that Git gutter indicators are scoped to the currently opened project folder. When making a change to `SomeChildProject` submodule, it would be awesome to see my gutter indicators there as well and see them as they apply to THAT nested Git project.

Related to: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/396

data.title: Support 'Restart Frame'
data.body:
Adopt the new `restartFrame` request by adding a 'Restart Frame' action to the Call Stack viewer. 

The debug protocol addition for this is: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/43

data.title: Git diff traversing buttons are missing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Win 7 Pro

Version 1.3 misses git diff traversing buttons when git file compare is opened:
![vsc13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2411422/16773936/cde70fa2-4827-11e6-9dc7-1e2261e6b332.png)

I guess it has something to do with new tabs feature. Right click gives missing options but it's really tedious to right click every time you want to move to the next change...

Older version 1.1 looked like this:
![vsc11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2411422/16773984/06b2e2ac-4828-11e6-85a5-e25039e84edf.png)

Also it would be nice to have some keyboard shortcut for this.
